metadata.title: CVE-2023-6560 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
An out-of-bounds memory access flaw was found in the io_uring SQ/CQ ringsfunctionality in the Linux kernel. This issue could allow a local user tocrash the system.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-6560` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.13.0-19-generic - 5.13.0-19.19

linux-image-unsigned-5.13.0-19-lowlatency - 5.13.0-19.19

criterions.comment: linux package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.13.0-19.19').
linux-hwe-5.19: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-hwe-6.2').
